entry.title: Crystal Report - design question since can't have subreport within subreport
entry.content:
Hello, may I have help solving this problem?

The top level entity we are reporting on is a customer System.  Systems can have Sites and Sites can  have Access Contacts.  I am working with a report developed previously by a coworker and at that time we didn't have the best database design.  The Sites record had 4 slots for contact information.  So our subreport structure was as below.

System Data II was the main report.  Most of this report comes from our system data record.  Then we have another table of sites and a query xrySystemToSites which gets all the sites for that system.  The subreport SiteSub is in the Report Footer of System Data II.  Site Sub was created with the report wizard so it doesn't exist as its own rpt file.

Today, we no longer have 4 hardcoded access contacts.  We have another table where each site can have 0 to n contacts.  So I am replacing the AccessContacts area on the top right with...well, I don't know what I am replacing it with because I haven't gotten anything to work.

If I save SiteSub to an external rpt and then work with it as the top level report, it correctly pulls in the next subreport I wrote to get all contacts for a given site, but as we all know once I try to link Report->SubReport->SubReport, it will not work.

So my design problem is 1:many (systems to sites) then another 1:many (sites to contacts).  I want a section with the heading Sites, present site #1's data with its variable number of contacts , site #2 with its data and contacts, etc.  Thank you for any help!

entry.title: Re: Can the Forward Automation Settings be turned off or...
entry.content:
Hello @Noni 

In a three-system DTP environment, you can prevent changes made in the Test (T) system from being transported to Production (P) by adjusting STMS transport routes to eliminate the T → P path or setting them to manual. Additionally, restrict import permissions in Production to only allow approved transports. Removing start days in the scheduling screen won’t be effective if the system needs at least one; instead, disable or delete the automation.

Let me know if you need further assistance

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Fiscal year variant V3 is not defined for calendar ye...
entry.content:
This typically occurs when:

  • an asset master record has an incorrect or defaulted capitalization date or activation date set to 01.01.1900.
  • Fiscal year variant V3 (April–March) is not defined for calendar year 1900 because it's not a valid business year.

Below are the recommended fix

  • Check Asset Master Data via AS03 for asset 40000003-0 in CoCd 1810. Review the capitalization date, activation date, and depreciation start date. If any of these are set to 01.01.1900, update them to a valid date (e.g., 01.04.2023).
  • Validate Fiscal Year variant settings via OB29 to confirm that V3 is defined for all relevant calendar years (from 2006 onward). You do not need to define it for 1900, as that year should never be used.
  • Check Asset Transaction history via AW01N to view asset values and transaction history. Look for any legacy data or migration entries that might have defaulted to 1900.
  • Finally, If the asset was migrated incorrectly, consider recreating the asset with correct dates using AS91 (Legacy Asset Transfer) with proper values and dates

entry.title: Re: "Parking Lot" for approval of Sales Order W...
entry.content:
While SAP Flexible Workflow doesn’t natively support “parking” sales orders like FI documents, you can design a gated approval trigger using one of the following approaches:

Option 1: Use a Custom Status or Field to Trigger Workflow

  • Add a custom field (e.g., “Ready for Approval”) to the sales order header.
  • Initially set this field to blank or ‘No’ when the order is created.
  • Only when the customer requests delivery, set the field to ‘Yes’.
  • Configure the Flexible Workflow start condition to trigger only when this field = ‘Yes’.

Benefits:

  • Approvers only receive relevant orders.
  • Orders remain blocked until explicitly marked for approval.


Option 2: Use a Custom Workflow Scenario with Delayed Trigger

  • Create a custom workflow scenario that listens for a specific change event (e.g., delivery date update or status change).
  • Trigger the workflow only when the order is updated to reflect readiness for delivery.

Technical Notes:

Use BAdI SD_SALES_DOCUMENT_WORKFLOW to define custom start conditions.
You may also use event linkage via SWEC to trigger workflow on change.


Option 3: Use a “Parking Lot” Table or App

Create a custom Fiori app or table where sales orders are “parked” until the business user marks them as ready. Once marked, the app triggers the workflow using API or event.

entry.title: Re: Upgrade of SAP S4H Public Cloud - Manage My Views
entry.content:
Hello @JAS3311 

There is no automated way to transfer personal views from the deprecated Manage Journal Entries app (F0717) to the new Manage Journal Entries app (F0717A) in S4HANA Public cloud.

You must manually rebuild the views in F0717A, as S4 Public Cloud does not support migration between different app IDs.

3591778 - F0717A Manage Journal Entries - New Version: Additional Authorisation Checks

Adapting SAP Fiori UIs at Runtime - Key User Adaptation

With rergards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP Private Cloud provides a different client for each user.
entry.content: 3 things that SAP logon procedure needs are: client, user & password. User must know which client they are logging into. You can may setup helpful instructions, to enable the user to select the correct client: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/how-to-change-the-initial-logon-screen-information-in-sap-application/ba-p/13311492

entry.title: Re: Best practices for splitting software collections wit...
entry.content:
Hello @TAKUMIKURASHIMO 

You can’t partially release a software collection; all objects in it must be released together in the S4 HANA Public cloud

Below are SAP Best practices

  • Group objects with direct technical dependencies in the same collection.
  • Split unrelated features or workstreams into separate collections to allow independent releases.
  • Keep business roles/catalogues in their own collection.
  • Use Where-Used analysis to check for hidden dependencies before splitting.

This ensures dependency safety while giving you more flexible release cycles.

Check below SAP Reference documentations

  • SAP Help Portal – Managing Software Collections
  • SAP Help Portal – Where-Used Analysis for Extensibility Objects

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to avoid 0% VAT journal entries in the reports?
entry.content:
Hello @rekafulop 

You cannot modify or delete the 0% rate for a delivered tax code such as V0, as it is necessary for legal reporting in S4HANA Public cloud.
To exclude these from reports, either filter them out in the reporting application or develop a custom analytical query that excludes the 0% tax code.

Check below SAP useful documentations References

  • 3566751 - Error “define the tax code on level” in SSCUI 101016 - Define Tax Codes for Sales and Purchases
  • SAP Help Portal – Custom Analytical Queries

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to check the outgoing message in the app Process...

  3. Click on XML to view the message.

entry.title: 🇩🇪 Build AI services using the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and Generative AI Hub
entry.content:
This SAP CodeJam event is on the topic of Build AI services using the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model, SAP AI Core and Generative AI Hub. It is beneficial if you have some basic knowledge about JavaScript as we're using the SAP Cloud SDK for AI with the JavaScript variant.

This CodeJam introduces attendees to aspects of exposing generative artificial intelligence (genAI) capabilities to execute tasks using a given business context.

During this event, you'll become acquainted with the theory behind genAI, SAP AI Core, SAP AI Launchpad, and learn how to use the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model to expose AI capabilities through your own OData service.

While working through the exercises, you'll become comfortable creating CDS-based service definitions and integrating them into the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) and SAP AI Core Foundation Models.

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Tuesday September 16th, 2025 in Cologne, Germany 🇩🇪 from 10:00 am - 4:00 pm. The workshop site will be the NEOMATIC AG office in Cologne Germany. The event will be held in english.

Thanks to NEOMATIC for hosting this event!

The instructor is the Developer Advocate @KRiedelsheimer 

Prerequisites: Any Chromium-based web browser, such as Google Chrome.

Please note that seating is limited - we can accommodate 25-30 attendees. Register here in the Community Event using the RSVP functionality.

For more information on SAP CodeJam events, to ask questions, and to chat with your fellow attendees, head over to the SAP CodeJam group.

entry.content:
Hello,

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) answers your question?

To create billing items in a commercial project using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, you can use the API for Project Billing Request available on the SAP API Business Hub. API for Project Billing Request This API allows you to generate a Project Billing Request, which can include various contract types or usages, and is essential for managing billing items in commercial projects.

For more details, you can refer to the API Business Hub where you can find comprehensive documentation and examples on how to use this API effectively.

API for Project Billing Request

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: Customer consignment process in SAP S4HANA with EWM a...
entry.content:
It depends on the Business requirement.  In standard, you need to create Consignment Issue order manually and if it is to be automated, couple of options are there

1. EDI Integration (Electronic Data Interchange)

  • Customers send consumption reports via EDI messages (e.g., IDoc type ORDERS05).
  • SAP receives the inbound message and automatically creates a sales order of type KE or CCIS.
  • This can trigger subsequent delivery and goods issue steps.

Go through this SAP Help portal

2. SAP Fiori App + Scheduled Job

  • Use the “Manage Sales Orders” Fiori app to create consignment issue orders.
  • Combine with a custom Fiori app or background job that reads customer consumption data from a file or interface and creates orders via BAPI (BAPI_SALESORDER_CREATEFROMDAT2).

3. API-Based Integration

SAP S/4HANA exposes OData and SOAP APIs for sales order creation. You can explore on this.

entry.title: Re: Validation using External Hooks in SAP Sales Cloud V2
entry.content:
Hi @Harish_Singh 
I'm trying to do a similar functionality on the case entity. I have the below structure cds file

service CNS  @(path: '/ext/api/v1') {
      type object {}
      action processData(entity: String, beforeImage: object, currentImage: object, context: object) returns object
}
When I try to test via POSTMAN using the sample payload that is retrieved by generating the payload from case entity as shared by @arulraj_athiseharan, an error is returned mentioning that properties like id, displayId, etc., are not defined (400 - Error: Property "referenceProduct" does not exist in beforeImage/currentImage).
 
So, I generated the schema for case entity and defined all the properties and then test via POSTMAN and the it was successful. However, there seems to be an issue with actual properties between the generate schema vs what V2 sends for case entity, like isRecommendedCaseType, etc., were not part of the generated schema.
type object {
        id: String;
        displayId: String(35);
        ... (other properties)
       action processData(entity: String, beforeImage: object, currentImage: object, context: HookContext) returns HookResponse;
}
 
But as per your code it looks like you were able to achieve this without declaring all the properties, Am I missing anything?
 
 
Regards,
Harsha

entry.title: Re: From Application Logging to Cloud Logging: Service Innovation Guide
entry.content:
Dear Watchers, 

We posted updates to the blog post covering two important topics. 

Support for Cloud Foundry container metrics

  • SAP Cloud Logging supports Cloud Foundry container metrics as of Aug 2025 (see what's new section). CC: @akuller 

OpenSearch 2.x phased roll-out

  •  Since Jul 10 2025, we run Explore phase where users can opt-in to update to 2.x version. Read more in announcement in What's new section and https://me.sap.com/notes/3617458 for details and timeline. Start exploring OpenSearch 2.x and provide feedback.

Some of the other questions are answered via SNOW/Email - if not kindly post again. For questions regarding, guide on instance sharing and guide on roles, we aim to publish additional blog posts soon. We will update here after publishing.

Best Regards, Cloud Logging Team

entry.title: Difference in Call Behavior Between Single-Cycle Plan and Multiple-Counter Plan
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I created both a single-cycle maintenance plan and a multiple-counter maintenance plan, each with:

  • The same cycle: 3 months

  • The same start date: 11.08.2024

However, the results were different:

  • In the single-cycle plan, the system generated all the old work orders as expected.

  • In the multiple-counter plan, only one work order was generated.

Could someone explain the logic behind this difference in SAP’s scheduling behavior?

Thank you in advance for your insights.

Best regards,

entry.title: New Features and Fixes: Share Buttons, Notifications Feed, and More
entry.content:
We’ve just rolled out the following improvements to the SAP Community platform, including one of the most highly demanded features from our feedback list. Read on to discover what has changed!

Share Buttons Now Available

Members have been asking for this feature for many months, and it’s finally here! You are now able to share content easily with the click of a button.

You have the option to share via email (letter icon) or directly to Bluesky or Linkedin. You can even copy the link if that’s your preference.

You’ll find these buttons at the very bottom of the pages for blog posts, questions, discussions, events, and knowledge-base documents – after the replies.

Fix for the Notifications Feed

If you use your notification feed to find new content in SAP Community, you may have noticed that when you clicked on the notifications button…

…you may have ended up looking at a long list of new activity – with more notifications than a single page could handle. And if you scrolled down, you may have seen a spinning wheel, making you think that the page was loading.

Only it wasn’t.

Well, if you didn’t notice, other members did, and they let us know all about it, as shown in this feedback.

With this fix, the wheel is now gone, making it clearer that members need to click the “Show more” button to load more notifications.

Sort Options Added to Knowledge Bases

We had previously added sort features to a variety of activity feeds – such as blog posts and discussions. We’ve now introduced the same sort options for documents in our knowledge bases.

Within the activity area of a knowledge base, you can sort its documents by creation date, most recent, most viewed, most commented, and most liked.

More to Come!

That’s it for now, but we’re far from finished. We have several additional new improvements scheduled for later this month. Remember to keep an eye on What’s New for future announcements. Better yet, select “Options” in the upper right of the What’s New section, then select “Subscribe,” so you’ll never miss an update!

entry.title: Re: SAP Master Data Integration (MDI) – Bank and Cost Center Replication from S/4HANA
entry.content:
@SachinDhingra Thank you for the feedback.
The postman credentials are created as service key from the MDI instance created for target testing. The Same is then also used for the pull distribution model setup.
For ease of using Postman, we first save the environment variables with the mdiUrl, xsuaaUrl, clientid, clientsecret, odmversion, odmentity.
Then we need to get the authorization token with POST call to the path - {{xsuaaUrl}}/oauth/token
Once the token is fetched, we can use that token to get the entries with the Get call to path:
{{mdiUrl}}/v1/odm/{{odmVersion}}/{{fullyQualifiedOdmEntityName}}/events

Hope this helps!

entry.title: Manage software collection which is exported by mistake with all items
entry.content:
Hi SAP Team,

User has exported software collection version with all items in it by mistake and got imported to Test system. This version has many items created by different users.

Only single item which consists in this software collection need to be moved to Production now and other items are not to be moved to production.

Please let us know how to manage this situation.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Manage software collection which is exported by mista...
entry.content:
In order to correct this you can simply discard the current version and either move the single item (and its dependencies) to a new collection or add it to a hotfix collection (HFC).

See the section for "Discard" in the following documentation:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/74940689b4a54c89a04f11dc2247701a.html

entry.title: Where can I configure the Supply Chain Unit (GR Office) information?
entry.content:
The customer would like to know where they could configure the Supply Chain Unit (GR Office) information. This information appears when checking the Inbound Delivery header details in the Warehouse Monitor APP.

In addition, they would like to know if when checking the inbound delivery item, the Owner and the Disposal Party (Party Entitled to Dispose) will be always the same.

 

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Where can I configure the Supply Chain Unit (GR Offic...
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

After setting the configuration activity 102657 (Set Warehouse Address), the Supply Chain Unit is created referred to: SCU_<WH No> with warehouse address (copied from plant address). This value is then set automatically and can appears for example in the Inbound Delivery header details in the Warehouse Monitor APP afterwards.

Regarding the second question, that's correct. Although the field is named as “Owner”, in our internal tables the technical field name is still “Custodian”. Therefore it still holds the information of warehouse owner but not the stock. 

To see more about Custodian field, please check: 

How can I configure the Supply chain unit, Party entitled to dispose, Custodian to EWM warehouse?

Best regards,

Geovana

entry.title: How to avoid confirmed quantity to become zero after saving sales order?
entry.content:
The customer would like to know how can they avoid the system to always delete the confirmed quantity after saving the sales order.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to avoid confirmed quantity to become zero after...
entry.content:
In the current system design, when you apply a delivery block at the header level of a sales order, the system automatically transfers the requested delivery quantity to all schedule lines. As part of this process, any previously confirmed quantity is removed, which can result in the confirmed quantity becoming zero.

If your intention is to keep the confirmed quantity unchanged, you may consider applying the delivery block at the schedule line level instead. In this case, the system does not reset the confirmed quantity.

For a detailed explanation of this behavior, you can consult the F1 Help for the delivery block field at both header and schedule line levels, where the differences are documented.

entry.title: Re: How to avoid confirmed quantity to become zero after...
entry.content: Great answer!

entry.title: Re: No change number prompt while creating BOM in public...
entry.content:
Hello @Nody 

You can enable ECM for BOMs in S4HANA Public Cloud BOMs via SSCUI 201029, but you cannot set up an automatic change-number prompt; the user must manually select to work with ECM when creating or modifying a BOM.

SAP Useful documentation

  • Implementing Engineering Change Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • Manage Bills of Material App-F4339

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP ByD. Customer Invoicing - Invoice Documents: add...
entry.content:
Hello @KCPN 

In SAP Business ByDesign, 0% VAT lines in Customer Invoicing → Invoice Documents can't be hidden through configuration alone. Instead, you must filter them out in the list view using the tax code (for example, exclude V0) and save this view as either personal or shared. There is no system setting to completely hide these lines without impacting tax reporting.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP Supply Chain Management Certification: Increase Your Expertise and Credibility
entry.content:
Running sustainable, resilient supply chains amid disruptions has become a driving force in many organizations. While supply chains have historically prioritized efficiency and cost reduction, digital technologies are delivering incredible gains to achieve even greater outcomes, while connecting processes and enabling faster insights.

In these times of rapid innovation, it’s becoming increasingly more critical to stay informed of the latest positioning guidance for SAP supply chain solutions. SAP has addressed this need by offering a non-technical certification option: Positioning SAP Business Suite via SAP Supply Chain Management Solutions. The non-technical certifications options are designed to be completed in a matter of few hours, thus making it a great option for individuals who are new to certification, looking to replace an expired certification, or simply interested in cultivating expertise with selling SAP supply chain solutions. 

Becoming certified in SAP supply chain management solutions will prepare you to gain the confidence and trust in your biggest stakeholder, the Chief Operating Officer (“COO”). The self-paced learning content will cover these key areas:

  • The end-to-end solution portfolio and how it addresses key priorities for the COO
  • How to position Supply Chain Management solutions in the context of SAP Business Suite
  • How AI is being used today in modern business settings as well as how it fits into the SAP’s Business AI strategy.
  • Selling SAP Supply Chain Management solutions to the COO through qualification, discovery, and packaging. 

Upon completing the digital learning, your certification attainment is achieved by:

  • Successful completion of a one-hour exam that will include thirty questions derived from the self-paced learning content
  • Submission of one of the following hands-on exercises:
    • Articulating the value of SAP supply chain solutions through an executive pitch
    • Demonstrating the value of SAP supply chain solutions by performing a demo.

Don’t Delay—take advantage of this opportunity to establish your credibility in SAP supply chain management and showcase your accomplishment. With around 5 hours of self-paced learning, this certification option is achievable for any busy professional and will provide tangible value in your field of expertise. Visit the SAP Learning Site to review the available certifications and select Positioning SAP Business Suite via SAP Supply Chain Management so you can start expertly positioning SAP’s supply chain management solutions to solve your customer’s key challenges and deliver real-world results.

Lauren Edwards

SAP Industries & Experience, Partner Solution Enablement - Supply Chain Management
